Eventually, Nathan was safely traced by police to a shelter in Dundee, where he was found in good health.

On the day of his disappearance, he mentioned to a friend over coffee at their book club meeting his intention to visit the river. Later, at around 7 PM, a passerby saw him near the banks of the Dundee Road, Arbroath, close to the river. His son, Justin Price, grew concerned when Nathan failed to appear for a scheduled lunch the following day and promptly reported him missing. A focused search was launched around the river.
